Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods

Class Minotaur

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.GodStrategy
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.Minotaur
public class Minotaur
extends GodStrategy
This class implements the Minotaur strategy used by the Player who chose the powers of this God. Specifically, Minotaur allows the selected worker to move to an opponent Worker's space, if the opponent Worker can be forced on space straight backwards to an unoccupied space at any level.

    • opponentWorkerMoverDelegate

      private final OpponentWorkerMoverDelegate opponentWorkerMoverDelegate
      Delegation pattern (composition over inheritance) is used to share common behaviours between gods and to allow a single god to inherit multiple common properties.

      OpponentWorkerMoverDelegate is used by Minotaur to move an opponent worker, if necessary.

    • backwardCell

      private Cell backwardCell
      This Cell represents the new position of the opponent, if the Cell where Minotaur wants to move is already occupied.

  • Method Details

    • checkMove

      public boolean checkMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
      Implements standard controls on worker movement if the moveCell is empty. Otherwise, it's necessary to check that the opponent worker's backward Cell is unoccupied (it needs to be empty and without a Dome on it).
      Overrides:
      checkMove in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      Returns:
      true if the Move passed as parameter can be performed, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.checkMove(Worker, Cell), computeBackwardCell(Board, Cell, Cell)

    • executeMove

      public void executeMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
      Implements standard execute worker movement, but if moveCell is not empty, the opponent's worker that is occupying moveCell must be moved to the backward Cell, and this is done delegating to OpponentWorkerMoverDelegate.
      Overrides:
      executeMove in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.executeMove(Worker, Cell), OpponentWorkerMoverDelegate.moveOpponentWorker(Worker, Cell)

    • computeBackwardCell

      private Cell computeBackwardCell​(Board board, Cell workerCell, Cell moveCell) throws InvalidCellException
      This method finds opponent Worker backward Cell, using the original Player Worker to determine the moving direction (diagonal or not).
      Parameters:
      board - the game board
      workerCell - the position of worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      Returns:
      The Cell that is backward of moveCell.
      Throws:
      InvalidCellException

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove​(Board board, Player player)
      This method checks if Minotaur's Player has at least an available Cell to move to.
      Overrides:
      canMove in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      board - the Match board to consider
      player - the Player whose ability to move is about to be tested
      Returns:
      true if Minotaur Player can move, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.canMove(it.polimi.ingsw.model.Board, it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player)

    • canMinotaurMoveFromCell

      private boolean canMinotaurMoveFromCell​(Board board, Cell cell)
      This method checks if Minotaur's Worker has at least an available Cell to move to. The main difference from a "standard" canMove, is that here we must consider that Minotaur can push its position to an opponent Worker's position, so we avoid to check if adjacent cells are empty, but we must ensure that there's a backward cell available where the opponent can be pushed to.
      Parameters:
      board - the Match board to consider
      cell - the Cell from which the worker would move
      Returns:
      true if an Minotaur movement is possible from the cell passed by parameter, false otherwise.
